meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new climate or environment after a period of absence.
meanings.sent1: After living in a warm place for years, she is reacclimatizing to the cold weather here.
meanings.sent2: The birds are reacclimatizing to their natural habitat after being in captivity.
meanings.sent3: The penguin joked that it was reacclimatizing to the tropical island life.
meanings.sent4: Like a plant reacclimatizing to a different soil, she slowly adjusted to her new surroundings.
meanings.sent5: Reacclimatizing to the mountain air, he felt invigorated and alive.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming accustomed to a new climate or environment again.
meanings.sent1: The reacclimatizing of the polar bears to the Arctic conditions was carefully monitored.
meanings.sent2: Her reacclimatizing to the bustling city life took some time but eventually felt natural.
meanings.sent3: The reacclimatizing of the fish to the larger tank made them swim happily around.
meanings.sent4: In the reacclimatizing of the trees to the changing seasons, their leaves turned vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The reacclimatizing of the hikers to the high altitude was challenging but rewarding.
